issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Names should appear in the same table as other tags

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: When I create a volume the tag editor lets me add ten things, but if I entered a name in the box above that the console will happily create the volume, add the "Name" tag and nine of the ten other tags, and then blow up on the tenth with the message, "You may not add more than ten tags to a resource."
fields.summary: "Create new volume" page lets me add eleven tags, blows up later

comments.body:
Pull request is created for UX review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1135

instance, volume, and snapshot use a tag for the name.

security group and scaling group have their own name attributes.

Hi [~kyolee], the tag editor in your branch wouldn't allow me to add more than a couple of tags before the Add Tag button just....stopped adding them. 

It was the same on Chrome and FF. I am on OSX 10.10. Video attached showing what it does on Chrome.
You are not allowed to add a tag with the same key name. Try 1=a, 2=b, 3=c, so on.

Hi [~kyolee], the 10 tag limit works correctly now, yay!

We need a validation error message when I try and enter a key that is already in use, instead of it just displaying no message and not letting me continue. Can you display a validation error message below that field please in that case that says "Key already in use, please use another key."

The duplicated tag warning message has been added.

Ready for UX review at

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1135

Hi Kyo, I see the validation message now, but I have a couple of questions (maybe [~kgill] can answer them as well) before I pass this, because the display is lacking a bit in the user-friendliness department.

I entered a key into the key field, and got multiple validation error messages on that field, and well as validation errors on the value field when I hadn't even left the original field yet. 

My questions are: 
1) Can we just display the validation error message that is relevant for the key field (the key name is already in use), and not display the part of the message about length and AWS: ?
2) can we not display the validation error on the value field before I have gotten to it, please? My cursor is still in the Key field and that is the one that has the problem...

Please let me know. 

Thanks!
[~kyolee], that looks AWESOME! Please just pass this one directly to [~kgill] for code review, no need for me to look at it again. Thanks!

[~jloza]

When tested both on Chrome and Firefox, the issue that you were seeing was not reproducible. See the attachment.

It appears that the javascript was not loaded properly, or using a cached javascript from previous load. Be sure that the browser's loading the latest JavaScript from the branch.

Please let me know if you are still seeing the same issue.

Thank you!
UX review passed, ready for code review.
Punting back to [~kyolee] to fix errant name tag logic in autoscaling tag editor (i.e. autoscaling groups don't use the "Name" tag to set the name).
Removed the unused 'isNameIncluded' function from the autoscaling tag editor.

Verified that a proper notice is displayed when attempting to add too many tags on the Create Volume page.  

The notice displayed is the following when 9 tags are added and the Name input field is non-blank...

{code}
You may not add more than ten tags to a resource. Note that one of your tags is being used to display the resource name.
{code}

Screenshot of verification attached.

Tested with the following…
Account: ui-test-acct-02/admin
CLC host: 10.111.5.201
Console package:  4.1.0-0.0.4998.289.20141219gita4af989.el6
Browser: Firefox 34
